AllergyIntolerance.definition: Risk of harmful or undesirable, physiological response which is unique to an individual and associated with exposure to a substance.

children.name: identifier
children.definition: This records identifiers associated with this allergy/intolerance concern that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written / printed documentation).

children.name: clinicalStatus
children.definition: The clinical status of the allergy or intolerance.

children.name: verificationStatus
children.definition: Assertion about certainty associated with the propensity, or potential risk, of a reaction to the identified substance (including pharmaceutical product).

children.name: type
children.definition: Identification of the underlying physiological mechanism for the reaction risk.

children.name: category
children.definition: Category of the identified substance.

children.name: criticality
children.definition: Estimate of the potential clinical harm, or seriousness, of the reaction to the identified substance.

children.name: code
children.definition: Code for an allergy or intolerance statement (either a positive or a negated/excluded statement).  This may be a code for a substance or pharmaceutical product that is considered to be responsible for the adverse reaction risk (e.g., "Latex"), an allergy or intolerance condition (e.g., "Latex allergy"), or a negated/excluded code for a specific substance or class (e.g., "No latex allergy") or a general or categorical negated statement (e.g.,  "No known allergy", "No known drug allergies").

children.name: patient
children.definition: The patient who has the allergy or intolerance.

children.name: onsetDateTime
children.definition: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age when allergy or intolerance was identified.

children.name: onsetAge
children.definition: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age when allergy or intolerance was identified.

children.name: onsetPeriod
children.definition: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age when allergy or intolerance was identified.

children.name: onsetRange
children.definition: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age when allergy or intolerance was identified.

children.name: onsetString
children.definition: Estimated or actual date,  date-time, or age when allergy or intolerance was identified.

children.name: assertedDate
children.definition: The date on which the existance of the AllergyIntolerance was first asserted or acknowledged.

children.name: recorder
children.definition: Individual who recorded the record and takes responsibility for its content.

children.name: asserter
children.definition: The source of the information about the allergy that is recorded.

children.name: lastOccurrence
children.definition: Represents the date and/or time of the last known occurrence of a reaction event.

children.name: note
children.definition: Additional narrative about the propensity for the Adverse Reaction, not captured in other fields.

children.name: reaction
children.definition: Details about each adverse reaction event linked to exposure to the identified substance.

children.name: substance
children.definition: Identification of the specific substance (or pharmaceutical product) considered to be responsible for the Adverse Reaction event. Note: the substance for a specific reaction may be different from the substance identified as the cause of the risk, but it must be consistent with it. For instance, it may be a more specific substance (e.g. a brand medication) or a composite product that includes the identified substance. It must be clinically safe to only process the 'code' and ignore the 'reaction.substance'.

children.name: manifestation
children.definition: Clinical symptoms and/or signs that are observed or associated with the adverse reaction event.

children.name: description
children.definition: Text description about the reaction as a whole, including details of the manifestation if required.

children.name: onset
children.definition: Record of the date and/or time of the onset of the Reaction.

children.name: severity
children.definition: Clinical assessment of the severity of the reaction event as a whole, potentially considering multiple different manifestations.

children.name: exposureRoute
children.definition: Identification of the route by which the subject was exposed to the substance.

children.name: note
children.definition: Additional text about the adverse reaction event not captured in other fields.

CarePlan.definition: Describes the intention of how one or more practitioners intend to deliver care for a particular patient, group or community for a period of time, possibly limited to care for a specific condition or set of conditions.

children.name: identifier
children.definition: This records identifiers associated with this care plan that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written / printed documentation).

children.name: definition
children.definition: Identifies the protocol, questionnaire, guideline or other specification the care plan should be conducted in accordance with.

children.name: basedOn
children.definition: A care plan that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this care plan.

children.name: replaces
children.definition: Completed or terminated care plan whose function is taken by this new care plan.

children.name: partOf
children.definition: A larger care plan of which this particular care plan is a component or step.

children.name: status
children.definition: Indicates whether the plan is currently being acted upon, represents future intentions or is now a historical record.

children.name: intent
children.definition: Indicates the level of authority/intentionality associated with the care plan and where the care plan fits into the workflow chain.

children.name: category
children.definition: Identifies what "kind" of plan this is to support differentiation between multiple co-existing plans; e.g. "Home health", "psychiatric", "asthma", "disease management", "wellness plan", etc.

children.name: title
children.definition: Human-friendly name for the CarePlan.

children.name: description
children.definition: A description of the scope and nature of the plan.

children.name: subject
children.definition: Identifies the patient or group whose intended care is described by the plan.

children.name: context
children.definition: Identifies the original context in which this particular CarePlan was created.

children.name: period
children.definition: Indicates when the plan did (or is intended to) come into effect and end.

children.name: author
children.definition: Identifies the individual(s) or ogranization who is responsible for the content of the care plan.

children.name: careTeam
children.definition: Identifies all people and organizations who are expected to be involved in the care envisioned by this plan.

children.name: addresses
children.definition: Identifies the conditions/problems/concerns/diagnoses/etc. whose management and/or mitigation are handled by this plan.

children.name: supportingInfo
children.definition: Identifies portions of the patient's record that specifically influenced the formation of the plan.  These might include co-morbidities, recent procedures, limitations, recent assessments, etc.

children.name: goal
children.definition: Describes the intended objective(s) of carrying out the care plan.

children.name: activity
children.definition: Identifies a planned action to occur as part of the plan.  For example, a medication to be used, lab tests to perform, self-monitoring, education, etc.

children.name: outcomeCodeableConcept
children.definition: Identifies the outcome at the point when the status of the activity is assessed.  For example, the outcome of an education activity could be patient understands (or not).

children.name: outcomeReference
children.definition: Details of the outcome or action resulting from the activity.  The reference to an "event" resource, such as Procedure or Encounter or Observation, is the result/outcome of the activity itself.  The activity can be conveyed using CarePlan.activity.detail OR using the CarePlan.activity.reference (a reference to a “request” resource).

children.name: progress
children.definition: Notes about the adherence/status/progress of the activity.

children.name: reference
children.definition: The details of the proposed activity represented in a specific resource.

children.name: detail
children.definition: A simple summary of a planned activity suitable for a general care plan system (e.g. form driven) that doesn't know about specific resources such as procedure etc.

children.name: category
children.definition: High-level categorization of the type of activity in a care plan.

children.name: definition
children.definition: Identifies the protocol, questionnaire, guideline or other specification the planned activity should be conducted in accordance with.

children.name: code
children.definition: Detailed description of the type of planned activity; e.g. What lab test, what procedure, what kind of encounter.

children.name: reasonCode
children.definition: Provides the rationale that drove the inclusion of this particular activity as part of the plan or the reason why the activity was prohibited.

children.name: reasonReference
children.definition: Provides the health condition(s) that drove the inclusion of this particular activity as part of the plan.

children.name: goal
children.definition: Internal reference that identifies the goals that this activity is intended to contribute towards meeting.

children.name: status
children.definition: Identifies what progress is being made for the specific activity.

children.name: statusReason
children.definition: Provides reason why the activity isn't yet started, is on hold, was cancelled, etc.

children.name: prohibited
children.definition: If true, indicates that the described activity is one that must NOT be engaged in when following the plan.  If false, indicates that the described activity is one that should be engaged in when following the plan.

children.name: scheduledTiming
children.definition: The period, timing or frequency upon which the described activity is to occur.

children.name: scheduledPeriod
children.definition: The period, timing or frequency upon which the described activity is to occur.

children.name: scheduledString
children.definition: The period, timing or frequency upon which the described activity is to occur.

children.name: location
children.definition: Identifies the facility where the activity will occur; e.g. home, hospital, specific clinic, etc.

children.name: performer
children.definition: Identifies who's expected to be involved in the activity.

children.name: productCodeableConcept
children.definition: Identifies the food, drug or other product to be consumed or supplied in the activity.

children.name: productReference
children.definition: Identifies the food, drug or other product to be consumed or supplied in the activity.

children.name: dailyAmount
children.definition: Identifies the quantity expected to be consumed in a given day.

children.name: quantity
children.definition: Identifies the quantity expected to be supplied, administered or consumed by the subject.

children.name: description
children.definition: This provides a textual description of constraints on the intended activity occurrence, including relation to other activities.  It may also include objectives, pre-conditions and end-conditions.  Finally, it may convey specifics about the activity such as body site, method, route, etc.

children.name: note
children.definition: General notes about the care plan not covered elsewhere.

Claim.definition: A provider issued list of services and products provided, or to be provided, to a patient which is provided to an insurer for payment recovery.

children.name: identifier
children.definition: The business identifier for the instance: claim number, pre-determination or pre-authorization number.

children.name: status
children.definition: The status of the resource instance.

children.name: type
children.definition: The category of claim, eg, oral, pharmacy, vision, insitutional, professional.

children.name: subType
children.definition: A finer grained suite of claim subtype codes which may convey Inpatient vs Outpatient and/or a specialty service. In the US the BillType.

children.name: use
children.definition: Complete (Bill or Claim), Proposed (Pre-Authorization), Exploratory (Pre-determination).

children.name: patient
children.definition: Patient Resource.

children.name: billablePeriod
children.definition: The billable period for which charges are being submitted.

children.name: created
children.definition: The date when the enclosed suite of services were performed or completed.

children.name: enterer
children.definition: Person who created the invoice/claim/pre-determination or pre-authorization.

children.name: insurer
children.definition: The Insurer who is target of the request.

children.name: provider
children.definition: The provider which is responsible for the bill, claim pre-determination, pre-authorization.

children.name: organization
children.definition: The organization which is responsible for the bill, claim pre-determination, pre-authorization.

children.name: priority
children.definition: Immediate (STAT), best effort (NORMAL), deferred (DEFER).

children.name: fundsReserve
children.definition: In the case of a Pre-Determination/Pre-Authorization the provider may request that funds in the amount of the expected Benefit be reserved ('Patient' or 'Provider') to pay for the Benefits determined on the subsequent claim(s). 'None' explicitly indicates no funds reserving is requested.

children.name: related
children.definition: Other claims which are related to this claim such as prior claim versions or for related services.

children.name: claim
children.definition: Other claims which are related to this claim such as prior claim versions or for related services.

children.name: relationship
children.definition: For example prior or umbrella.

children.name: reference
children.definition: An alternate organizational reference to the case or file to which this particular claim pertains - eg Property/Casualy insurer claim # or Workers Compensation case # .

children.name: prescription
children.definition: Prescription to support the dispensing of Pharmacy or Vision products.

children.name: originalPrescription
children.definition: Original prescription which has been superceded by this prescription to support the dispensing of pharmacy services, medications or products. For example, a physician may prescribe a medication which the pharmacy determines is contraindicated, or for which the patient has an intolerance, and therefor issues a new precription for an alternate medication which has the same theraputic intent. The prescription from the pharmacy becomes the 'prescription' and that from the physician becomes the 'original prescription'.

children.name: payee
children.definition: The party to be reimbursed for the services.

children.name: type
children.definition: Type of Party to be reimbursed: Subscriber, provider, other.

children.name: resourceType
children.definition: organization | patient | practitioner | relatedperson.

children.name: party
children.definition: Party to be reimbursed: Subscriber, provider, other.

children.name: referral
children.definition: The referral resource which lists the date, practitioner, reason and other supporting information.

children.name: facility
children.definition: Facility where the services were provided.

children.name: careTeam
children.definition: The members of the team who provided the overall service as well as their role and whether responsible and qualifications.

children.name: sequence
children.definition: Sequence of the careTeam which serves to order and provide a link.

children.name: provider
children.definition: Member of the team who provided the overall service.

children.name: responsible
children.definition: The party who is billing and responsible for the claimed good or service rendered to the patient.

children.name: role
children.definition: The lead, assisting or supervising practitioner and their discipline if a multidisiplinary team.

children.name: qualification
children.definition: The qualification which is applicable for this service.

children.name: information
children.definition: Additional information codes regarding exceptions, special considerations, the condition, situation, prior or concurrent issues. Often there are mutiple jurisdiction specific valuesets which are required.

children.name: sequence
children.definition: Sequence of the information element which serves to provide a link.

children.name: category
children.definition: The general class of the information supplied: information; exception; accident, employment; onset, etc.

children.name: code
children.definition: System and code pertaining to the specific information regarding special conditions relating to the setting, treatment or patient  for which care is sought which may influence the adjudication.

children.name: timingDate
children.definition: The date when or period to which this information refers.

children.name: timingPeriod
children.definition: The date when or period to which this information refers.

children.name: valueString
children.definition: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

children.name: valueQuantity
children.definition: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

children.name: valueAttachment
children.definition: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

children.name: valueReference
children.definition: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

children.name: reason
children.definition: For example, provides the reason for: the additional stay, or missing tooth or any other situation where a reason code is required in addition to the content.

children.name: diagnosis
children.definition: List of patient diagnosis for which care is sought.

children.name: sequence
children.definition: Sequence of diagnosis which serves to provide a link.

children.name: diagnosisCodeableConcept
children.definition: The diagnosis.

children.name: diagnosisReference
children.definition: The diagnosis.

children.name: type
children.definition: The type of the Diagnosis, for example: admitting, primary, secondary, discharge.

children.name: packageCode
children.definition: The package billing code, for example DRG, based on the assigned grouping code system.

children.name: procedure
children.definition: Ordered list of patient procedures performed to support the adjudication.

children.name: sequence
children.definition: Sequence of procedures which serves to order and provide a link.

children.name: date
children.definition: Date and optionally time the procedure was performed .

children.name: procedureCodeableConcept
children.definition: The procedure code.

children.name: procedureReference
children.definition: The procedure code.

children.name: insurance
children.definition: Financial instrument by which payment information for health care.

children.name: sequence
children.definition: Sequence of coverage which serves to provide a link and convey coordination of benefit order.

children.name: focal
children.definition: A flag to indicate that this Coverage is the focus for adjudication. The Coverage against which the claim is to be adjudicated.

children.name: coverage
children.definition: Reference to the program or plan identification, underwriter or payor.

children.name: businessArrangement
children.definition: The contract number of a business agreement which describes the terms and conditions.

children.name: preAuthRef
children.definition: A list of references from the Insurer to which these services pertain.

children.name: claimResponse
children.definition: The Coverages adjudication details.

children.name: accident
children.definition: An accident which resulted in the need for healthcare services.

children.name: date
children.definition: Date of an accident which these services are addressing.

children.name: type
children.definition: Type of accident: work, auto, etc.

children.name: locationAddress
children.definition: Accident Place.

children.name: locationReference
children.definition: Accident Place.

children.name: employmentImpacted
children.definition: The start and optional end dates of when the patient was precluded from working due to the treatable condition(s).

children.name: hospitalization
children.definition: The start and optional end dates of when the patient was confined to a treatment center.

children.name: item
children.definition: First tier of goods and services.

children.name: sequence
children.definition: A service line number.

children.name: careTeamLinkId
children.definition: CareTeam applicable for this service or product line.

children.name: diagnosisLinkId
children.definition: Diagnosis applicable for this service or product line.

children.name: procedureLinkId
children.definition: Procedures applicable for this service or product line.

children.name: informationLinkId
children.definition: Exceptions, special conditions and supporting information pplicable for this service or product line.

children.name: revenue
children.definition: The type of reveneu or cost center providing the product and/or service.

children.name: category
children.definition: Health Care Service Type Codes  to identify the classification of service or benefits.

children.name: service
children.definition: If this is an actual service or product line, ie. not a Group, then use code to indicate the Professional Service or Product supplied (eg. CTP, HCPCS,USCLS,ICD10, NCPDP,DIN,RXNorm,ACHI,CCI). If a grouping item then use a group code to indicate the type of thing being grouped eg. 'glasses' or 'compound'.

children.name: modifier
children.definition: Item typification or modifiers codes, eg for Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or for medical whether the treatment was outside the clinic or out of office hours.

children.name: programCode
children.definition: For programs which require reason codes for the inclusion or covering of this billed item under the program or sub-program.

children.name: servicedDate
children.definition: The date or dates when the enclosed suite of services were performed or completed.

children.name: servicedPeriod
children.definition: The date or dates when the enclosed suite of services were performed or completed.

children.name: locationCodeableConcept
children.definition: Where the service was provided.

children.name: locationAddress
children.definition: Where the service was provided.

children.name: locationReference
children.definition: Where the service was provided.

children.name: quantity
children.definition: The number of repetitions of a service or product.

children.name: unitPrice
children.definition: If the item is a node then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the children of the group.

children.name: factor
children.definition: A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.

children.name: net
children.definition: The quantity times the unit price for an addittional service or product or charge. For example, the formula: unit Quantity * unit Price (Cost per Point) * factor Number  * points = net Amount. Quantity, factor and points are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.

children.name: udi
children.definition: List of Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.

children.name: bodySite
children.definition: Physical service site on the patient (limb, tooth, etc).

children.name: subSite
children.definition: A region or surface of the site, eg. limb region or tooth surface(s).

children.name: encounter
children.definition: A billed item may include goods or services provided in multiple encounters.

children.name: detail
children.definition: Second tier of goods and services.

children.name: sequence
children.definition: A service line number.

children.name: revenue
children.definition: The type of reveneu or cost center providing the product and/or service.

children.name: category
children.definition: Health Care Service Type Codes  to identify the classification of service or benefits.

children.name: service
children.definition: If this is an actual service or product line, ie. not a Group, then use code to indicate the Professional Service or Product supplied (eg. CTP, HCPCS,USCLS,ICD10, NCPDP,DIN,ACHI,CCI). If a grouping item then use a group code to indicate the type of thing being grouped eg. 'glasses' or 'compound'.

children.name: modifier
children.definition: Item typification or modifiers codes, eg for Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or for medical whether the treatment was outside the clinic or out of office hours.

children.name: programCode
children.definition: For programs which require reson codes for the inclusion, covering, of this billed item under the program or sub-program.

children.name: quantity
children.definition: The number of repetitions of a service or product.

children.name: unitPrice
children.definition: If the item is a node then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the children of the group.

children.name: factor

children.name: net

children.name: udi
children.definition: List of Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.

children.name: subDetail
children.definition: Third tier of goods and services.

children.name: sequence
children.definition: A service line number.

children.name: revenue
children.definition: The type of reveneu or cost center providing the product and/or service.

children.name: category
children.definition: Health Care Service Type Codes  to identify the classification of service or benefits.

children.name: service
children.definition: A code to indicate the Professional Service or Product supplied (eg. CTP, HCPCS,USCLS,ICD10, NCPDP,DIN,ACHI,CCI).

children.name: modifier

children.name: programCode
children.definition: For programs which require reson codes for the inclusion, covering, of this billed item under the program or sub-program.

children.name: quantity
children.definition: The number of repetitions of a service or product.

children.name: unitPrice
children.definition: The fee for an addittional service or product or charge.

children.name: factor
children.definition: A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.

children.name: net

children.name: udi
children.definition: List of Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.

children.name: total
children.definition: The total value of the claim.

Condition.definition: A clinical condition, problem, diagnosis, or other event, situation, issue, or clinical concept that has risen to a level of concern.

children.name: identifier
children.definition: This records identifiers associated with this condition that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written / printed documentation).

children.name: clinicalStatus
children.definition: The clinical status of the condition.

children.name: verificationStatus
children.definition: The verification status to support the clinical status of the condition.

children.name: category
children.definition: A category assigned to the condition.

children.name: severity
children.definition: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.

children.name: code
children.definition: Identification of the condition, problem or diagnosis.

children.name: bodySite
children.definition: The anatomical location where this condition manifests itself.

children.name: subject
children.definition: Indicates the patient or group who the condition record is associated with.

children.name: context
children.definition: Encounter during which the condition was first asserted.

children.name: onsetDateTime
children.definition: Estimated or actual date or date-time  the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician.

children.name: onsetAge
children.definition: Estimated or actual date or date-time  the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician.

children.name: onsetPeriod
children.definition: Estimated or actual date or date-time  the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician.

children.name: onsetRange
children.definition: Estimated or actual date or date-time  the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician.

children.name: onsetString
children.definition: Estimated or actual date or date-time  the condition began, in the opinion of the clinician.

children.name: abatementDateTime
children.definition: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate.

children.name: abatementAge
children.definition: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate.

children.name: abatementBoolean
children.definition: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate.

children.name: abatementPeriod
children.definition: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate.

children.name: abatementRange
children.definition: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate.

children.name: abatementString
children.definition: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission. This is called "abatement" because of the many overloaded connotations associated with "remission" or "resolution" - Conditions are never really resolved, but they can abate.

children.name: assertedDate
children.definition: The date on which the existance of the Condition was first asserted or acknowledged.

children.name: asserter
children.definition: Individual who is making the condition statement.

children.name: stage
children.definition: Clinical stage or grade of a condition. May include formal severity assessments.

children.name: summary
children.definition: A simple summary of the stage such as "Stage 3". The determination of the stage is disease-specific.

children.name: assessment
children.definition: Reference to a formal record of the evidence on which the staging assessment is based.

children.name: evidence
children.definition: Supporting Evidence / manifestations that are the basis on which this condition is suspected or confirmed.

children.name: code
children.definition: A manifestation or symptom that led to the recording of this condition.

children.name: detail
children.definition: Links to other relevant information, including pathology reports.

children.name: note
children.definition: Additional information about the Condition. This is a general notes/comments entry  for description of the Condition, its diagnosis and prognosis.

Coverage.definition: Financial instrument which may be used to reimburse or pay for health care products and services.

children.name: identifier
children.definition: The main (and possibly only) identifier for the coverage - often referred to as a Member Id, Certificate number, Personal Health Number or Case ID. May be constructed as the concatination of the Coverage.SubscriberID and the Coverage.dependant.

children.name: status
children.definition: The status of the resource instance.

children.name: type
children.definition: The type of coverage: social program, medical plan, accident coverage (workers compensation, auto), group health or payment by an individual or organization.

children.name: policyHolder
children.definition: The party who 'owns' the insurance policy,  may be an individual, corporation or the subscriber's employer.

children.name: subscriber
children.definition: The party who has signed-up for or 'owns' the contractual relationship to the policy or to whom the benefit of the policy for services rendered to them or their family is due.

children.name: subscriberId
children.definition: The insurer assigned ID for the Subscriber.

children.name: beneficiary
children.definition: The party who benefits from the insurance coverage., the patient when services are provided.

children.name: relationship
children.definition: The relationship of beneficiary (patient) to the subscriber.

children.name: period
children.definition: Time period during which the coverage is in force. A missing start date indicates the start date isn't known, a missing end date means the coverage is continuing to be in force.

children.name: payor
children.definition: The program or plan underwriter or payor including both insurance and non-insurance agreements, such as patient-pay agreements. May provide multiple identifiers such as insurance company identifier or business identifier (BIN number).

children.name: grouping
children.definition: A suite of underwrite specific classifiers, for example may be used to identify a class of coverage or employer group, Policy, Plan.

children.name: group
children.definition: Identifies a style or collective of coverage issued by the underwriter, for example may be used to identify an employer group. May also be referred to as a Policy or Group ID.

children.name: groupDisplay
children.definition: A short description for the group.

children.name: subGroup
children.definition: Identifies a style or collective of coverage issued by the underwriter, for example may be used to identify a subset of an employer group.

children.name: subGroupDisplay
children.definition: A short description for the subgroup.

children.name: plan
children.definition: Identifies a style or collective of coverage issued by the underwriter, for example may be used to identify a collection of benefits provided to employees. May be referred to as a Section or Division ID.

children.name: planDisplay
children.definition: A short description for the plan.

children.name: subPlan
children.definition: Identifies a sub-style or sub-collective of coverage issued by the underwriter, for example may be used to identify a subset of a collection of benefits provided to employees.

children.name: subPlanDisplay
children.definition: A short description for the subplan.

children.name: class
children.definition: Identifies a style or collective of coverage issues by the underwriter, for example may be used to identify a class of coverage such as a level of deductables or co-payment.

children.name: classDisplay
children.definition: A short description for the class.

children.name: subClass
children.definition: Identifies a sub-style or sub-collective of coverage issues by the underwriter, for example may be used to identify a subclass of coverage such as a sub-level of deductables or co-payment.

children.name: subClassDisplay
children.definition: A short description for the subclass.

children.name: dependent
children.definition: A unique identifier for a dependent under the coverage.

children.name: sequence
children.definition: An optional counter for a particular instance of the identified coverage which increments upon each renewal.

children.name: order
children.definition: The order of applicability of this coverage relative to other coverages which are currently inforce. Note, there may be gaps in the numbering and this does not imply primary, secondard etc. as the specific positioning of coverages depends upon the episode of care.

children.name: network
children.definition: The insurer-specific identifier for the insurer-defined network of providers to which the beneficiary may seek treatment which will be covered at the 'in-network' rate, otherwise 'out of network' terms and conditions apply.

children.name: contract
children.definition: The policy(s) which constitute this insurance coverage.

DiagnosticReport.definition: The findings and interpretation of diagnostic  tests performed on patients, groups of patients, devices, and locations, and/or specimens derived from these. The report includes clinical context such as requesting and provider information, and some mix of atomic results, images, textual and coded interpretations, and formatted representation of diagnostic reports.

children.name: identifier
children.definition: Identifiers assigned to this report by the performer or other systems.

children.name: basedOn
children.definition: Details concerning a test or procedure requested.

children.name: status
children.definition: The status of the diagnostic report as a whole.

children.name: category
children.definition: A code that classifies the clinical discipline, department or diagnostic service that created the report (e.g. cardiology, biochemistry, hematology, MRI). This is used for searching, sorting and display purposes.

children.name: code
children.definition: A code or name that describes this diagnostic report.

children.name: subject
children.definition: The subject of the report. Usually, but not always, this is a patient. However diagnostic services also perform analyses on specimens collected from a variety of other sources.

children.name: context
children.definition: The healthcare event  (e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction) which this DiagnosticReport per is about.

children.name: effectiveDateTime
children.definition: The time or time-period the observed values are related to. When the subject of the report is a patient, this is usually either the time of the procedure or of specimen collection(s), but very often the source of the date/time is not known, only the date/time itself.

children.name: effectivePeriod
children.definition: The time or time-period the observed values are related to. When the subject of the report is a patient, this is usually either the time of the procedure or of specimen collection(s), but very often the source of the date/time is not known, only the date/time itself.

children.name: issued
children.definition: The date and time that this version of the report was released from the source diagnostic service.

children.name: performer
children.definition: Indicates who or what participated in producing the report.

children.name: role
children.definition: Describes the type of participation (e.g.  a responsible party, author, or verifier).

children.name: actor
children.definition: The reference to the  practitioner or organization involved in producing the report. For example, the diagnostic service that is responsible for issuing the report.

children.name: specimen
children.definition: Details about the specimens on which this diagnostic report is based.

children.name: result
children.definition: Observations that are part of this diagnostic report. Observations can be simple name/value pairs (e.g. "atomic" results), or they can be grouping observations that include references to other members of the group (e.g. "panels").

children.name: imagingStudy
children.definition: One or more links to full details of any imaging performed during the diagnostic investigation. Typically, this is imaging performed by DICOM enabled modalities, but this is not required. A fully enabled PACS viewer can use this information to provide views of the source images.

children.name: image
children.definition: A list of key images associated with this report. The images are generally created during the diagnostic process, and may be directly of the patient, or of treated specimens (i.e. slides of interest).

children.name: comment
children.definition: A comment about the image. Typically, this is used to provide an explanation for why the image is included, or to draw the viewer's attention to important features.

children.name: link
children.definition: Reference to the image source.

children.name: conclusion
children.definition: Concise and clinically contextualized impression / summary of the diagnostic report.

children.name: codedDiagnosis
children.definition: Codes for the conclusion.

children.name: presentedForm
children.definition: Rich text representation of the entire result as issued by the diagnostic service. Multiple formats are allowed but they SHALL be semantically equivalent.

Encounter.definition: An interaction between a patient and healthcare provider(s) for the purpose of providing healthcare service(s) or assessing the health status of a patient.

children.name: identifier
children.definition: Identifier(s) by which this encounter is known.

children.name: status
children.definition: planned | arrived | triaged | in-progress | onleave | finished | cancelled +.

children.name: statusHistory
children.definition: The status history permits the encounter resource to contain the status history without needing to read through the historical versions of the resource, or even have the server store them.

children.name: status
children.definition: planned | arrived | triaged | in-progress | onleave | finished | cancelled +.

children.name: period
children.definition: The time that the episode was in the specified status.

children.name: class
children.definition: inpatient | outpatient | ambulatory | emergency +.

children.name: classHistory
children.definition:
The class history permits the tracking of the encounters transitions without needing to go  through the resource history.

This would be used for a case where an admission starts of as an emergency encounter, then transisions into an inpatient scenario. Doing this and not restarting a new encounter ensures that any lab/diagnostic results can more easily follow the patient and not require re-processing and not get lost or cancelled during a kindof discharge from emergency to inpatient.

children.name: class
children.definition: inpatient | outpatient | ambulatory | emergency +.

children.name: period
children.definition: The time that the episode was in the specified class.

children.name: type
children.definition: Specific type of encounter (e.g. e-mail consultation, surgical day-care, skilled nursing, rehabilitation).

children.name: priority
children.definition: Indicates the urgency of the encounter.

children.name: subject
children.definition: The patient ro group present at the encounter.

children.name: episodeOfCare
children.definition: Where a specific encounter should be classified as a part of a specific episode(s) of care this field should be used. This association can facilitate grouping of related encounters together for a specific purpose, such as government reporting, issue tracking, association via a common problem.  The association is recorded on the encounter as these are typically created after the episode of care, and grouped on entry rather than editing the episode of care to append another encounter to it (the episode of care could span years).

children.name: incomingReferral
children.definition: The referral request this encounter satisfies (incoming referral).

children.name: participant
children.definition: The list of people responsible for providing the service.

children.name: type
children.definition: Role of participant in encounter.

children.name: period
children.definition: The period of time that the specified participant participated in the encounter. These can overlap or be sub-sets of the overall encounter's period.

children.name: individual
children.definition: Persons involved in the encounter other than the patient.

children.name: appointment
children.definition: The appointment that scheduled this encounter.

children.name: period
children.definition: The start and end time of the encounter.

children.name: length
children.definition: Quantity of time the encounter lasted. This excludes the time during leaves of absence.

children.name: reason
children.definition: Reason the encounter takes place, expressed as a code. For admissions, this can be used for a coded admission diagnosis.

children.name: diagnosis
children.definition: The list of diagnosis relevant to this encounter.

children.name: condition
children.definition: Reason the encounter takes place, as specified using information from another resource. For admissions, this is the admission diagnosis. The indication will typically be a Condition (with other resources referenced in the evidence.detail), or a Procedure.

children.name: role
children.definition: Role that this diagnosis has within the encounter (e.g. admission, billing, discharge …).

children.name: rank
children.definition: Ranking of the diagnosis (for each role type).

children.name: account
children.definition: The set of accounts that may be used for billing for this Encounter.

children.name: hospitalization
children.definition: Details about the admission to a healthcare service.

children.name: preAdmissionIdentifier
children.definition: Pre-admission identifier.

children.name: origin
children.definition: The location from which the patient came before admission.

children.name: admitSource
children.definition: From where patient was admitted (physician referral, transfer).

children.name: reAdmission
children.definition: Whether this hospitalization is a readmission and why if known.

children.name: dietPreference
children.definition: Diet preferences reported by the patient.

children.name: specialCourtesy
children.definition: Special courtesies (VIP, board member).

children.name: specialArrangement
children.definition: Any special requests that have been made for this hospitalization encounter, such as the provision of specific equipment or other things.

children.name: destination
children.definition: Location to which the patient is discharged.

children.name: dischargeDisposition
children.definition: Category or kind of location after discharge.

children.name: location
children.definition: List of locations where  the patient has been during this encounter.

children.name: location
children.definition: The location where the encounter takes place.

children.name: status
children.definition: The status of the participants' presence at the specified location during the period specified. If the participant is is no longer at the location, then the period will have an end date/time.

children.name: period
children.definition: Time period during which the patient was present at the location.

children.name: serviceProvider
children.definition: An organization that is in charge of maintaining the information of this Encounter (e.g. who maintains the report or the master service catalog item, etc.). This MAY be the same as the organization on the Patient record, however it could be different. This MAY not be not the Service Delivery Location's Organization.

children.name: partOf
children.definition: Another Encounter of which this encounter is a part of (administratively or in time).

ExplanationOfBenefit.definition: This resource provides: the claim details; adjudication details from the processing of a Claim; and optionally account balance information, for informing the subscriber of the benefits provided.

children.name: identifier
children.definition: The EOB Business Identifier.

children.name: status
children.definition: The status of the resource instance.

children.name: type
children.definition: The category of claim, eg, oral, pharmacy, vision, insitutional, professional.

children.name: subType
children.definition: A finer grained suite of claim subtype codes which may convey Inpatient vs Outpatient and/or a specialty service. In the US the BillType.

children.name: patient
children.definition: Patient Resource.

children.name: billablePeriod
children.definition: The billable period for which charges are being submitted.

children.name: created
children.definition: The date when the EOB was created.

children.name: enterer
children.definition: The person who created the explanation of benefit.

children.name: insurer
children.definition: The insurer which is responsible for the explanation of benefit.

children.name: provider
children.definition: The provider which is responsible for the claim.

children.name: organization
children.definition: The provider which is responsible for the claim.

children.name: referral
children.definition: The referral resource which lists the date, practitioner, reason and other supporting information.

children.name: facility
children.definition: Facility where the services were provided.

children.name: claim
children.definition: The business identifier for the instance: invoice number, claim number, pre-determination or pre-authorization number.

children.name: claimResponse
children.definition: The business identifier for the instance: invoice number, claim number, pre-determination or pre-authorization number.

children.name: outcome
children.definition: Processing outcome errror, partial or complete processing.

children.name: disposition
children.definition: A description of the status of the adjudication.

children.name: related
children.definition: Other claims which are related to this claim such as prior claim versions or for related services.

children.name: claim
children.definition: Other claims which are related to this claim such as prior claim versions or for related services.

children.name: relationship
children.definition: For example prior or umbrella.

children.name: reference
children.definition: An alternate organizational reference to the case or file to which this particular claim pertains - eg Property/Casualy insurer claim # or Workers Compensation case # .

children.name: prescription
children.definition: Prescription to support the dispensing of Pharmacy or Vision products.

children.name: originalPrescription
children.definition: Original prescription which has been superceded by this prescription to support the dispensing of pharmacy services, medications or products. For example, a physician may prescribe a medication which the pharmacy determines is contraindicated, or for which the patient has an intolerance, and therefor issues a new precription for an alternate medication which has the same theraputic intent. The prescription from the pharmacy becomes the 'prescription' and that from the physician becomes the 'original prescription'.

children.name: payee
children.definition: The party to be reimbursed for the services.

children.name: type
children.definition: Type of Party to be reimbursed: Subscriber, provider, other.

children.name: resourceType
children.definition: organization | patient | practitioner | relatedperson.

children.name: party
children.definition: Party to be reimbursed: Subscriber, provider, other.

children.name: information
children.definition: Additional information codes regarding exceptions, special considerations, the condition, situation, prior or concurrent issues. Often there are mutiple jurisdiction specific valuesets which are required.

children.name: sequence
children.definition: Sequence of the information element which serves to provide a link.

children.name: category
children.definition: The general class of the information supplied: information; exception; accident, employment; onset, etc.

children.name: code
children.definition: System and code pertaining to the specific information regarding special conditions relating to the setting, treatment or patient  for which care is sought which may influence the adjudication.

children.name: timingDate
children.definition: The date when or period to which this information refers.

children.name: timingPeriod
children.definition: The date when or period to which this information refers.

children.name: valueString
children.definition: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

children.name: valueQuantity
children.definition: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

children.name: valueAttachment
children.definition: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

children.name: valueReference
children.definition: Additional data or information such as resources, documents, images etc. including references to the data or the actual inclusion of the data.

children.name: reason
children.definition: For example, provides the reason for: the additional stay, or missing tooth or any other situation where a reason code is required in addition to the content.

children.name: careTeam
children.definition: The members of the team who provided the overall service as well as their role and whether responsible and qualifications.

children.name: sequence
children.definition: Sequence of careteam which serves to order and provide a link.

children.name: provider
children.definition: The members of the team who provided the overall service.

children.name: responsible
children.definition: The practitioner who is billing and responsible for the claimed services rendered to the patient.

children.name: role
children.definition: The lead, assisting or supervising practitioner and their discipline if a multidisiplinary team.

children.name: qualification
children.definition: The qualification which is applicable for this service.

children.name: diagnosis
children.definition: Ordered list of patient diagnosis for which care is sought.

children.name: sequence
children.definition: Sequence of diagnosis which serves to provide a link.

children.name: diagnosisCodeableConcept
children.definition: The diagnosis.

children.name: diagnosisReference
children.definition: The diagnosis.

children.name: type
children.definition: The type of the Diagnosis, for example: admitting, primary, secondary, discharge.

children.name: packageCode
children.definition: The package billing code, for example DRG, based on the assigned grouping code system.

children.name: procedure
children.definition: Ordered list of patient procedures performed to support the adjudication.

children.name: sequence
children.definition: Sequence of procedures which serves to order and provide a link.

children.name: date
children.definition: Date and optionally time the procedure was performed .

children.name: procedureCodeableConcept
children.definition: The procedure code.

children.name: procedureReference
children.definition: The procedure code.

children.name: precedence
children.definition: Precedence (primary, secondary, etc.).

children.name: insurance
children.definition: Financial instrument by which payment information for health care.

children.name: coverage
children.definition: Reference to the program or plan identification, underwriter or payor.

children.name: preAuthRef
children.definition: A list of references from the Insurer to which these services pertain.

children.name: accident
children.definition: An accident which resulted in the need for healthcare services.

children.name: date
children.definition: Date of an accident which these services are addressing.

children.name: type
children.definition: Type of accident: work, auto, etc.

children.name: locationAddress
children.definition: Where the accident occurred.

children.name: locationReference
children.definition: Where the accident occurred.

children.name: employmentImpacted
children.definition: The start and optional end dates of when the patient was precluded from working due to the treatable condition(s).

children.name: hospitalization
children.definition: The start and optional end dates of when the patient was confined to a treatment center.

children.name: item
children.definition: First tier of goods and services.

children.name: sequence
children.definition: A service line number.

children.name: careTeamLinkId
children.definition: Careteam applicable for this service or product line.

children.name: diagnosisLinkId
children.definition: Diagnosis applicable for this service or product line.

children.name: procedureLinkId
children.definition: Procedures applicable for this service or product line.

children.name: informationLinkId
children.definition: Exceptions, special conditions and supporting information pplicable for this service or product line.

children.name: revenue
children.definition: The type of reveneu or cost center providing the product and/or service.

children.name: category
children.definition: Health Care Service Type Codes  to identify the classification of service or benefits.

children.name: service
children.definition: If this is an actual service or product line, ie. not a Group, then use code to indicate the Professional Service or Product supplied (eg. CTP, HCPCS,USCLS,ICD10, NCPDP,DIN,ACHI,CCI). If a grouping item then use a group code to indicate the type of thing being grouped eg. 'glasses' or 'compound'.

children.name: modifier
children.definition: Item typification or modifiers codes, eg for Oral whether the treatment is cosmetic or associated with TMJ, or for medical whether the treatment was outside the clinic or out of office hours.

children.name: programCode
children.definition: For programs which require reson codes for the inclusion, covering, of this billed item under the program or sub-program.

children.name: servicedDate
children.definition: The date or dates when the enclosed suite of services were performed or completed.

children.name: servicedPeriod
children.definition: The date or dates when the enclosed suite of services were performed or completed.

children.name: locationCodeableConcept
children.definition: Where the service was provided.

children.name: locationAddress
children.definition: Where the service was provided.

children.name: locationReference
children.definition: Where the service was provided.

children.name: quantity
children.definition: The number of repetitions of a service or product.

children.name: unitPrice
children.definition: If the item is a node then this is the fee for the product or service, otherwise this is the total of the fees for the children of the group.

children.name: factor
children.definition: A real number that represents a multiplier used in determining the overall value of services delivered and/or goods received. The concept of a Factor allows for a discount or surcharge multiplier to be applied to a monetary amount.

children.name: net
children.definition: The quantity times the unit price for an addittional service or product or charge. For example, the formula: unit Quantity * unit Price (Cost per Point) * factor Number  * points = net Amount. Quantity, factor and points are assumed to be 1 if not supplied.

children.name: udi
children.definition: List of Unique Device Identifiers associated with this line item.

children.name: bodySite
children.definition: Physical service site on the patient (limb, tooth, etc).

children.name: subSite
children.definition: A region or surface of the site, eg. limb region or tooth surface(s).

children.name: encounter
children.definition: A billed item may include goods or services provided in multiple encounters.

children.name: noteNumber
children.definition: A list of note references to the notes provided below.

children.name: adjudication
children.definition: The adjudications results.

children.name: category
children.definition: Code indicating: Co-Pay, deductable, elegible, benefit, tax, etc.

children.name: reason
children.definition: Adjudication reason such as limit reached.

children.name: amount
children.definition: Monitory amount associated with the code.

children.name: value
children.definition: A non-monetary value for example a percentage. Mutually exclusive to the amount element above.

children.name: detail
children.definition: Second tier of goods and services.

children.name: sequence
children.definition: A service line number.

children.name: type
children.definition: The type of product or service.

children.name: noteNumber

children.name: adjudication
