children.name: totalCost
children.definition: The total cost of the services reported.

children.name: unallocDeductable
children.definition: The amount of deductable applied which was not allocated to any particular service line.

children.name: totalBenefit
children.definition: Total amount of benefit payable (Equal to sum of the Benefit amounts from all detail lines and additions less the Unallocated Deductable).

children.name: payment
children.definition: Payment details for the claim if the claim has been paid.

children.name: type
children.definition: Whether this represents partial or complete payment of the claim.

children.name: adjustment
children.definition: Adjustment to the payment of this transaction which is not related to adjudication of this transaction.

children.name: adjustmentReason
children.definition: Reason for the payment adjustment.

children.name: date
children.definition: Estimated payment date.

children.name: amount
children.definition: Payable less any payment adjustment.

children.name: identifier
children.definition: Payment identifer.

children.name: form
children.definition: The form to be used for printing the content.

children.name: processNote
children.definition: Note text.

children.name: number
children.definition: An integer associated with each note which may be referred to from each service line item.

children.name: type
children.definition: The note purpose: Print/Display.

children.name: text
children.definition: The note text.

children.name: language
children.definition: The ISO-639-1 alpha 2 code in lower case for the language, optionally followed by a hyphen and the ISO-3166-1 alpha 2 code for the region in upper case; e.g. "en" for English, or "en-US" for American English versus "en-EN" for England English.

children.name: benefitBalance
children.definition: Balance by Benefit Category.

children.name: category
children.definition: Dental, Vision, Medical, Pharmacy, Rehab etc.

children.name: subCategory
children.definition: Dental: basic, major, ortho; Vision exam, glasses, contacts; etc.

children.name: excluded
children.definition: True if the indicated class of service is excluded from the plan, missing or False indicated the service is included in the coverage.

children.name: name
children.definition: A short name or tag for the benefit, for example MED01, or DENT2.

children.name: description
children.definition: A richer description of the benefit, for example 'DENT2 covers 100% of basic, 50% of major but exclused Ortho, Implants and Costmetic services'.

children.name: network
children.definition: Network designation.

children.name: unit
children.definition: Unit designation: individual or family.

children.name: term
children.definition: The term or period of the values such as 'maximum lifetime benefit' or 'maximum annual vistis'.

children.name: financial
children.definition: Benefits Used to date.

children.name: type
children.definition: Deductable, visits, benefit amount.

children.name: allowedUnsignedInt
children.definition: Benefits allowed.

children.name: allowedString
children.definition: Benefits allowed.

children.name: allowedMoney
children.definition: Benefits allowed.

children.name: usedUnsignedInt
children.definition: Benefits used.

children.name: usedMoney
children.definition: Benefits used.

ImagingStudy.definition: Representation of the content produced in a DICOM imaging study. A study comprises a set of series, each of which includes a set of Service-Object Pair Instances (SOP Instances - images or other data) acquired or produced in a common context.  A series is of only one modality (e.g. X-ray, CT, MR, ultrasound), but a study may have multiple series of different modalities.

children.name: uid
children.definition: Formal identifier for the study.

children.name: accession
children.definition: Accession Number is an identifier related to some aspect of imaging workflow and data management. Usage may vary across different institutions.  See for instance [IHE Radiology Technical Framework Volume 1 Appendix A](http://www.ihe.net/uploadedFiles/Documents/Radiology/IHE_RAD_TF_Rev13.0_Vol1_FT_2014-07-30.pdf).

children.name: identifier
children.definition: Other identifiers for the study.

children.name: availability
children.definition: Availability of study (online, offline, or nearline).

children.name: modalityList
children.definition: A list of all the Series.ImageModality values that are actual acquisition modalities, i.e. those in the DICOM Context Group 29 (value set OID 1.2.840.10008.6.1.19).

children.name: patient
children.definition: The patient imaged in the study.

children.name: context
children.definition: The encounter or episode at which the request is initiated.

children.name: started
children.definition: Date and time the study started.

children.name: basedOn
children.definition: A list of the diagnostic requests that resulted in this imaging study being performed.

children.name: referrer
children.definition: The requesting/referring physician.

children.name: interpreter
children.definition: Who read the study and interpreted the images or other content.

children.name: endpoint
children.definition: The network service providing access (e.g., query, view, or retrieval) for the study. See implementation notes for information about using DICOM endpoints. A study-level endpoint applies to each series in the study, unless overridden by a series-level endpoint with the same Endpoint.type.

children.name: numberOfSeries
children.definition: Number of Series in the Study. This value given may be larger than the number of series elements this Resource contains due to resource availability, security, or other factors. This element should be present if any series elements are present.

children.name: numberOfInstances
children.definition: Number of SOP Instances in Study. This value given may be larger than the number of instance elements this resource contains due to resource availability, security, or other factors. This element should be present if any instance elements are present.

children.name: procedureReference
children.definition: A reference to the performed Procedure.

children.name: procedureCode
children.definition: The code for the performed procedure type.

children.name: reason
children.definition: Description of clinical condition indicating why the ImagingStudy was requested.

children.name: description
children.definition: Institution-generated description or classification of the Study performed.

children.name: series
children.definition: Each study has one or more series of images or other content.

children.name: uid
children.definition: Formal identifier for this series.

children.name: number
children.definition: The numeric identifier of this series in the study.

children.name: modality
children.definition: The modality of this series sequence.

children.name: description
children.definition: A description of the series.

children.name: numberOfInstances
children.definition: Number of SOP Instances in the Study. The value given may be larger than the number of instance elements this resource contains due to resource availability, security, or other factors. This element should be present if any instance elements are present.

children.name: availability
children.definition: Availability of series (online, offline or nearline).

children.name: endpoint
children.definition: The network service providing access (e.g., query, view, or retrieval) for this series. See implementation notes for information about using DICOM endpoints. A series-level endpoint, if present, has precedence over a study-level endpoint with the same Endpoint.type.

children.name: bodySite
children.definition: The anatomic structures examined. See DICOM Part 16 Annex L (http://dicom.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part16/chapter_L.html) for DICOM to SNOMED-CT mappings. The bodySite may indicate the laterality of body part imaged; if so, it shall be consistent with any content of ImagingStudy.series.laterality.

children.name: laterality
children.definition: The laterality of the (possibly paired) anatomic structures examined. E.g., the left knee, both lungs, or unpaired abdomen. If present, shall be consistent with any laterality information indicated in ImagingStudy.series.bodySite.

children.name: started
children.definition: The date and time the series was started.

children.name: performer
children.definition: The physician or operator (often the radiology technician)  who performed the series. The performer is recorded at the series level, since each series in a study may be performed by a different practitioner, at different times, and using different devices. A series may be performed by multiple practitioners.

children.name: instance
children.definition: A single SOP instance within the series, e.g. an image, or presentation state.

children.name: uid
children.definition: Formal identifier for this image or other content.

children.name: number
children.definition: The number of instance in the series.

children.name: sopClass
children.definition: DICOM instance  type.

children.name: title
children.definition: The description of the instance.

Immunization.definition: Describes the event of a patient being administered a vaccination or a record of a vaccination as reported by a patient, a clinician or another party and may include vaccine reaction information and what vaccination protocol was followed.

children.name: identifier
children.definition: A unique identifier assigned to this immunization record.

children.name: status
children.definition: Indicates the current status of the vaccination event.

children.name: notGiven
children.definition: Indicates if the vaccination was or was not given.

children.name: vaccineCode
children.definition: Vaccine that was administered or was to be administered.

children.name: patient
children.definition: The patient who either received or did not receive the immunization.

children.name: encounter
children.definition: The visit or admission or other contact between patient and health care provider the immunization was performed as part of.

children.name: date
children.definition: Date vaccine administered or was to be administered.

children.name: primarySource
children.definition: An indication that the content of the record is based on information from the person who administered the vaccine. This reflects the context under which the data was originally recorded.

children.name: reportOrigin
children.definition: The source of the data when the report of the immunization event is not based on information from the person who administered the vaccine.

children.name: location
children.definition: The service delivery location where the vaccine administration occurred.

children.name: manufacturer
children.definition: Name of vaccine manufacturer.

children.name: lotNumber
children.definition: Lot number of the  vaccine product.

children.name: expirationDate
children.definition: Date vaccine batch expires.

children.name: site
children.definition: Body site where vaccine was administered.

children.name: route
children.definition: The path by which the vaccine product is taken into the body.

children.name: doseQuantity
children.definition: The quantity of vaccine product that was administered.

children.name: practitioner
children.definition: Indicates who or what performed the event.

children.name: role
children.definition: Describes the type of performance (e.g. ordering provider, administering provider, etc.).

children.name: actor
children.definition: The device, practitioner, etc. who performed the action.

children.name: note
children.definition: Extra information about the immunization that is not conveyed by the other attributes.

children.name: explanation
children.definition: Reasons why a vaccine was or was not administered.

children.name: reason
children.definition: Reasons why a vaccine was administered.

children.name: reasonNotGiven
children.definition: Reason why a vaccine was not administered.

children.name: reaction
children.definition: Categorical data indicating that an adverse event is associated in time to an immunization.

children.name: date
children.definition: Date of reaction to the immunization.

children.name: detail
children.definition: Details of the reaction.

children.name: reported
children.definition: Self-reported indicator.

children.name: vaccinationProtocol
children.definition: Contains information about the protocol(s) under which the vaccine was administered.

children.name: doseSequence
children.definition: Nominal position in a series.

children.name: description
children.definition: Contains the description about the protocol under which the vaccine was administered.

children.name: authority
children.definition: Indicates the authority who published the protocol.  E.g. ACIP.

children.name: series
children.definition: One possible path to achieve presumed immunity against a disease - within the context of an authority.

children.name: seriesDoses
children.definition: The recommended number of doses to achieve immunity.

children.name: targetDisease
children.definition: The targeted disease.

children.name: doseStatus
children.definition: Indicates if the immunization event should "count" against  the protocol.

children.name: doseStatusReason
children.definition: Provides an explanation as to why an immunization event should or should not count against the protocol.

MedicationRequest.definition: An order or request for both supply of the medication and the instructions for administration of the medication to a patient. The resource is called "MedicationRequest" rather than "MedicationPrescription" or "MedicationOrder" to generalize the use across inpatient and outpatient settings, including care plans, etc., and to harmonize with workflow patterns.

children.name: identifier
children.definition: This records identifiers associated with this medication request that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate. For example a re-imbursement system might issue its own id for each prescription that is created.  This is particularly important where FHIR only provides part of an entire workflow process where records must be tracked through an entire system.

children.name: definition
children.definition: Protocol or definition followed by this request.

children.name: basedOn
children.definition: A plan or request that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this medication request.

children.name: groupIdentifier
children.definition: A shared identifier common to all requests that were authorized more or less simultaneously by a single author, representing the identifier of the requisition or prescription.

children.name: status
children.definition: A code specifying the current state of the order.  Generally this will be active or completed state.

children.name: intent
children.definition: Whether the request is a proposal, plan, or an original order.

children.name: category
children.definition: Indicates the type of medication order and where the medication is expected to be consumed or administered.

children.name: priority
children.definition: Indicates how quickly the Medication Request should be addressed with respect to other requests.

children.name: medicationCodeableConcept
children.definition: Identifies the medication being requested. This is a link to a resource that represents the medication which may be the details of the medication or simply an attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.

children.name: medicationReference
children.definition: Identifies the medication being requested. This is a link to a resource that represents the medication which may be the details of the medication or simply an attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.

children.name: subject
children.definition: A link to a resource representing the person or set of individuals to whom the medication will be given.

children.name: context
children.definition: A link to an encounter, or episode of care, that identifies the particular occurrence or set occurrences of contact between patient and health care provider.

children.name: supportingInformation
children.definition: Include additional information (for example, patient height and weight) that supports the ordering of the medication.

children.name: authoredOn
children.definition: The date (and perhaps time) when the prescription was initially written or authored on.

children.name: requester
children.definition: The individual, organization or device that initiated the request and has responsibility for its activation.

children.name: agent
children.definition: The healthcare professional responsible for authorizing the initial prescription.

children.name: onBehalfOf
children.definition: The organization the device or practitioner was acting on behalf of.

children.name: recorder
children.definition: The person who entered the order on behalf of another individual for example in the case of a verbal or a telephone order.

children.name: reasonCode
children.definition: The reason or the indication for ordering the medication.

children.name: reasonReference
children.definition: Condition or observation that supports why the medication was ordered.

children.name: note
children.definition: Extra information about the prescription that could not be conveyed by the other attributes.

children.name: dosageInstruction
children.definition: Indicates how the medication is to be used by the patient.

children.name: dispenseRequest
children.definition: Indicates the specific details for the dispense or medication supply part of a medication request (also known as a Medication Prescription or Medication Order).  Note that this information is not always sent with the order.  There may be in some settings (e.g. hospitals) institutional or system support for completing the dispense details in the pharmacy department.

children.name: validityPeriod
children.definition: This indicates the validity period of a prescription (stale dating the Prescription).

children.name: numberOfRepeatsAllowed
children.definition: An integer indicating the number of times, in addition to the original dispense, (aka refills or repeats) that the patient can receive the prescribed medication. Usage Notes: This integer does not include the original order dispense. This means that if an order indicates dispense 30 tablets plus "3 repeats", then the order can be dispensed a total of 4 times and the patient can receive a total of 120 tablets.

children.name: quantity
children.definition: The amount that is to be dispensed for one fill.

children.name: expectedSupplyDuration
children.definition: Identifies the period time over which the supplied product is expected to be used, or the length of time the dispense is expected to last.

children.name: performer
children.definition: Indicates the intended dispensing Organization specified by the prescriber.

children.name: substitution
children.definition: Indicates whether or not substitution can or should be part of the dispense. In some cases substitution must happen, in other cases substitution must not happen. This block explains the prescriber's intent. If nothing is specified substitution may be done.

children.name: allowed
children.definition: True if the prescriber allows a different drug to be dispensed from what was prescribed.

children.name: reason
children.definition: Indicates the reason for the substitution, or why substitution must or must not be performed.

children.name: priorPrescription
children.definition: A link to a resource representing an earlier order related order or prescription.

children.name: detectedIssue
children.definition: Indicates an actual or potential clinical issue with or between one or more active or proposed clinical actions for a patient; e.g. Drug-drug interaction, duplicate therapy, dosage alert etc.

children.name: eventHistory
children.definition: Links to Provenance records for past versions of this resource or fulfilling request or event resources that identify key state transitions or updates that are likely to be relevant to a user looking at the current version of the resource.

Observation.definition: Measurements and simple assertions made about a patient, device or other subject.

children.name: identifier
children.definition: A unique identifier assigned to this observation.

children.name: basedOn
children.definition: A plan, proposal or order that is fulfilled in whole or in part by this event.

children.name: status
children.definition: The status of the result value.

children.name: category
children.definition: A code that classifies the general type of observation being made.

children.name: code
children.definition: Describes what was observed. Sometimes this is called the observation "name".

children.name: subject
children.definition: The patient, or group of patients, location, or device whose characteristics (direct or indirect) are described by the observation and into whose record the observation is placed.  Comments: Indirect characteristics may be those of a specimen, fetus, donor,  other observer (for example a relative or EMT), or any observation made about the subject.

children.name: context
children.definition: The healthcare event  (e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction) during which this observation is made.

children.name: effectiveDateTime
children.definition: The time or time-period the observed value is asserted as being true. For biological subjects - e.g. human patients - this is usually called the "physiologically relevant time". This is usually either the time of the procedure or of specimen collection, but very often the source of the date/time is not known, only the date/time itself.

children.name: effectivePeriod
children.definition: The time or time-period the observed value is asserted as being true. For biological subjects - e.g. human patients - this is usually called the "physiologically relevant time". This is usually either the time of the procedure or of specimen collection, but very often the source of the date/time is not known, only the date/time itself.

children.name: issued
children.definition: The date and time this observation was made available to providers, typically after the results have been reviewed and verified.

children.name: performer
children.definition: Who was responsible for asserting the observed value as "true".

children.name: valueQuantity
children.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

children.name: valueCodeableConcept
children.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

children.name: valueString
children.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

children.name: valueBoolean
children.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

children.name: valueRange
children.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

children.name: valueRatio
children.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

children.name: valueSampledData
children.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

children.name: valueAttachment
children.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

children.name: valueTime
children.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

children.name: valueDateTime
children.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

children.name: valuePeriod
children.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

children.name: dataAbsentReason
children.definition: Provides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing.

children.name: interpretation
children.definition: The assessment made based on the result of the observation.  Intended as a simple compact code often placed adjacent to the result value in reports and flow sheets to signal the meaning/normalcy status of the result. Otherwise known as abnormal flag.

children.name: comment
children.definition: May include statements about significant, unexpected or unreliable values, or information about the source of the value where this may be relevant to the interpretation of the result.

children.name: bodySite
children.definition: Indicates the site on the subject's body where the observation was made (i.e. the target site).

children.name: method
children.definition: Indicates the mechanism used to perform the observation.

children.name: specimen
children.definition: The specimen that was used when this observation was made.

children.name: device
children.definition: The device used to generate the observation data.

children.name: referenceRange
children.definition: Guidance on how to interpret the value by comparison to a normal or recommended range.

children.name: low
children.definition: The value of the low bound of the reference range.  The low bound of the reference range endpoint is inclusive of the value (e.g.  reference range is >=5 - <=9).   If the low bound is omitted,  it is assumed to be meaningless (e.g. reference range is <=2.3).

children.name: high
children.definition: The value of the high bound of the reference range.  The high bound of the reference range endpoint is inclusive of the value (e.g.  reference range is >=5 - <=9).   If the high bound is omitted,  it is assumed to be meaningless (e.g. reference range is >= 2.3).

children.name: type
children.definition: Codes to indicate the what part of the targeted reference population it applies to. For example, the normal or therapeutic range.

children.name: appliesTo
children.definition: Codes to indicate the target population this reference range applies to.  For example, a reference range may be based on the normal population or a particular sex or race.

children.name: age
children.definition: The age at which this reference range is applicable. This is a neonatal age (e.g. number of weeks at term) if the meaning says so.

children.name: text
children.definition: Text based reference range in an observation which may be used when a quantitative range is not appropriate for an observation.  An example would be a reference value of "Negative" or a list or table of 'normals'.

children.name: related
children.definition: A  reference to another resource (usually another Observation) whose relationship is defined by the relationship type code.

children.name: type
children.definition: A code specifying the kind of relationship that exists with the target resource.

children.name: target
children.definition: A reference to the observation or [QuestionnaireResponse](questionnaireresponse.html#) resource that is related to this observation.

children.name: component
children.definition: Some observations have multiple component observations.  These component observations are expressed as separate code value pairs that share the same attributes.  Examples include systolic and diastolic component observations for blood pressure measurement and multiple component observations for genetics observations.

children.name: code
children.definition: Describes what was observed. Sometimes this is called the observation "code".

children.name: valueQuantity
children.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

children.name: valueCodeableConcept
children.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

children.name: valueString
children.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

children.name: valueRange
children.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

children.name: valueRatio
children.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

children.name: valueSampledData
children.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

children.name: valueAttachment
children.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

children.name: valueTime
children.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

children.name: valueDateTime
children.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

children.name: valuePeriod
children.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.

children.name: dataAbsentReason
children.definition: Provides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing.

children.name: interpretation
children.definition: The assessment made based on the result of the observation.  Intended as a simple compact code often placed adjacent to the result value in reports and flow sheets to signal the meaning/normalcy status of the result. Otherwise known as abnormal flag.

children.name: referenceRange
children.definition: Guidance on how to interpret the value by comparison to a normal or recommended range.

Patient.definition: Demographics and other administrative information about an individual or animal receiving care or other health-related services.

children.name: identifier
children.definition: An identifier for this patient.

children.name: active
children.definition: Whether this patient record is in active use.

children.name: name
children.definition: A name associated with the individual.

children.name: telecom
children.definition: A contact detail (e.g. a telephone number or an email address) by which the individual may be contacted.

children.name: gender
children.definition: Administrative Gender - the gender that the patient is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes.

children.name: birthDate
children.definition: The date of birth for the individual.

children.name: deceasedBoolean
children.definition: Indicates if the individual is deceased or not.

children.name: deceasedDateTime
children.definition: Indicates if the individual is deceased or not.

children.name: address
children.definition: Addresses for the individual.

children.name: maritalStatus
children.definition: This field contains a patient's most recent marital (civil) status.

children.name: multipleBirthBoolean
children.definition: Indicates whether the patient is part of a multiple (bool) or indicates the actual birth order (integer).

children.name: multipleBirthInteger
children.definition: Indicates whether the patient is part of a multiple (bool) or indicates the actual birth order (integer).

children.name: photo
children.definition: Image of the patient.

children.name: contact
children.definition: A contact party (e.g. guardian, partner, friend) for the patient.

children.name: relationship
children.definition: The nature of the relationship between the patient and the contact person.

children.name: name
children.definition: A name associated with the contact person.

children.name: telecom
children.definition: A contact detail for the person, e.g. a telephone number or an email address.

children.name: address
children.definition: Address for the contact person.

children.name: gender
children.definition: Administrative Gender - the gender that the contact person is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes.

children.name: organization
children.definition: Organization on behalf of which the contact is acting or for which the contact is working.

children.name: period
children.definition: The period during which this contact person or organization is valid to be contacted relating to this patient.

children.name: animal
children.definition: This patient is known to be an animal.

children.name: species
children.definition: Identifies the high level taxonomic categorization of the kind of animal.

children.name: breed
children.definition: Identifies the detailed categorization of the kind of animal.

children.name: genderStatus
children.definition: Indicates the current state of the animal's reproductive organs.

children.name: communication
children.definition: Languages which may be used to communicate with the patient about his or her health.

children.name: language
children.definition: The ISO-639-1 alpha 2 code in lower case for the language, optionally followed by a hyphen and the ISO-3166-1 alpha 2 code for the region in upper case; e.g. "en" for English, or "en-US" for American English versus "en-EN" for England English.

children.name: preferred
children.definition: Indicates whether or not the patient prefers this language (over other languages he masters up a certain level).

children.name: generalPractitioner
children.definition: Patient's nominated care provider.

children.name: managingOrganization
children.definition: Organization that is the custodian of the patient record.

children.name: link
children.definition: Link to another patient resource that concerns the same actual patient.

children.name: other
children.definition: The other patient resource that the link refers to.

children.name: type
children.definition: The type of link between this patient resource and another patient resource.

ProcedureRequest.definition: A record of a request for diagnostic investigations, treatments, or operations to be performed.

children.name: identifier
children.definition: Identifiers assigned to this order instance by the orderer and/or the receiver and/or order fulfiller.

children.name: definition
children.definition: Protocol or definition followed by this request.

children.name: basedOn
children.definition: Plan/proposal/order fulfilled by this request.

children.name: replaces
children.definition: The request takes the place of the referenced completed or terminated request(s).

children.name: requisition
children.definition: A shared identifier common to all procedure or diagnostic requests that were authorized more or less simultaneously by a single author, representing the composite or group identifier.

children.name: status
children.definition: The status of the order.

children.name: intent
children.definition: Whether the request is a proposal, plan, an original order or a reflex order.

children.name: priority
children.definition: Indicates how quickly the ProcedureRequest should be addressed with respect to other requests.

children.name: doNotPerform
children.definition: Set this to true if the record is saying that the procedure should NOT be performed.

children.name: category
children.definition: A code that classifies the procedure for searching, sorting and display purposes (e.g. "Surgical Procedure").

children.name: code
children.definition: A code that identifies a particular procedure, diagnostic investigation, or panel of investigations, that have been requested.

children.name: subject
children.definition: On whom or what the procedure or diagnostic is to be performed. This is usually a human patient, but can also be requested on animals, groups of humans or animals, devices such as dialysis machines, or even locations (typically for environmental scans).

children.name: context
children.definition: An encounter or episode of care that provides additional information about the healthcare context in which this request is made.

children.name: occurrenceDateTime
children.definition: The date/time at which the diagnostic testing should occur.

children.name: occurrencePeriod
children.definition: The date/time at which the diagnostic testing should occur.

children.name: occurrenceTiming
children.definition: The date/time at which the diagnostic testing should occur.

children.name: asNeededBoolean
children.definition: If a CodeableConcept is present, it indicates the pre-condition for performing the procedure.  For example "pain", "on flare-up", etc.

children.name: asNeededCodeableConcept
children.definition: If a CodeableConcept is present, it indicates the pre-condition for performing the procedure.  For example "pain", "on flare-up", etc.

children.name: authoredOn
children.definition: When the request transitioned to being actionable.

children.name: requester
children.definition: The individual who initiated the request and has responsibility for its activation.

children.name: agent
children.definition: The device, practitioner or organization who initiated the request.

children.name: onBehalfOf
children.definition: The organization the device or practitioner was acting on behalf of.

children.name: performerType
children.definition: Desired type of performer for doing the diagnostic testing.

children.name: performer
children.definition: The desired perfomer for doing the diagnostic testing.  For example, the surgeon, dermatopathologist, endoscopist, etc.

children.name: reasonCode
children.definition: An explanation or justification for why this diagnostic investigation is being requested in coded or textual form.   This is often for billing purposes.  May relate to the resources referred to in supportingInformation.

children.name: reasonReference
children.definition: Indicates another resource that provides a justification for why this diagnostic investigation is being requested.   May relate to the resources referred to in supportingInformation.

children.name: supportingInfo
children.definition: Additional clinical information about the patient or specimen that may influence the procedure or diagnostics or their interpretations.     This information includes diagnosis, clinical findings and other observations.  In laboratory ordering these are typically referred to as "ask at order entry questions (AOEs)".  This includes observations explicitly requested by the producer (filler) to provide context or supporting information needed to complete the order. For example,  reporting the amount of inspired oxygen for blood gas measurements.

children.name: specimen
children.definition: One or more specimens that the laboratory procedure will use.

children.name: bodySite
children.definition: Anatomic location where the procedure should be performed. This is the target site.

children.name: note
children.definition: Any other notes and comments made about the service request. For example, letting provider know that "patient hates needles" or other provider instructions.

children.name: relevantHistory
children.definition: Key events in the history of the request.
